to recite command line commands on a phone interview?
to them?  Anyone else feel the same about not being able to recite commands off the top of your head, but if you actually get on the command line it starts to come back to you?
explain why ) - you're 80% way down to getting the offer
interview_tips: on how to approach this situation early in my career
you never say you are advanced in seniority, i
you're in a targeted audience when applying for internship/full-time, it is denoted by "graduating in or after 201x"

red_flags: use leetcode etc for interviews, ever - for the reason that will be clear below
force me to explain how that works
even bother checking what the static code analysis tells them about the code duplication
buy the argument that the function call would slow down things - we're seldom competing for nanoseconds, and it's not your call anyway
really care at all what they already know
look at resumes at all -- they contain almost no useful information
tell me much about the actual projects: did they do it on their own, with a team, did they do the work or did someone else, was it done with quality o

process_insights.format: Mix of phone screen, technical, behavioral, on-site, virtual
